it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments

Class LimitedContinuos2D<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.AbstractEnvironment<T>
      • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment<T>
        • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.Continuous2DEnvironment<T>
          • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.LimitedContinuos2D<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnvironment<T>, Serializable, Iterable<INode<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Continuous2DObstacles, InfiniteHalls

    public abstract class LimitedContinuos2D<T>
extends Continuous2DEnvironment<T>
    This class represents a 2D continuous environment with spatial limitations. Those limitations will prevent nodes to move in positions which are not allowed.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void moveNodeToPosition(INode<T> node,
                               IPosition newPos)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        This method moves a node in the environment to some position. If node move is unsupported, it does nothing.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        node - The node to move
        newPos - The absolute position in which this node will be moved.

        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment

        Parameters:

      • addNode

        public void addNode(INode<T> node,
                    IPosition p)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        This method allows to add a new node to this environment. The environment is responsible to call the right method of the simulation in order to ensure that the reaction is properly scheduled.
        Specified by:
        addNode in interface IEnvironment<T>
        Overrides:
        addNode in class Continuous2DEnvironment<T>
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add
        p - The position where to place it

      • next

        protected abstract IPosition next(double ox,
                                  double oy,
                                  double nx,
                                  double ny)
        This method must calculate the ABSOLUTE next allowed position given the current position and the position in which the node wants to move. For example, if your node is in position [2,3], wants to move to [3,4] but the next allowed position (because, e.g., of physical obstacles) is [2.5,3.5], the result must be a IPosition containing coordinates [2.5,3.5].
        Parameters:
        ox - The current X position
        oy - The current Y position
        nx - The requested X position
        ny - The requested Y position
        Returns:
        the next allowed position, where the node can actually move. This position MUST be considered as a vector whose start point is in [ox, oy].

      • isAllowed

        protected abstract boolean isAllowed(IPosition p)
        Checks whether a position is allowed to be occupied by a node in this environment.
        Parameters:
        p - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if the position is allowed
